descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of personal boundaries or the concept of appropriate vs. inappropriate touching.
Shows a minimal understanding of personal boundaries, struggling to differentiate between appropriate and inappropriate touching in most scenarios.
Demonstrates a basic understanding of personal boundaries but may still confuse appropriate and inappropriate touching in certain situations.
Clearly understands personal boundaries and can generally differentiate between appropriate and inappropriate touching.
Exhibits a strong understanding of personal boundaries and can confidently distinguish between appropriate and inappropriate touching in various contexts.

Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of personal boundaries, consistently differentiating between appropriate and inappropriate touching while also showing empathy and respect for others' boundaries.
Unable to identify any instances of inappropriate touching.
Can identify only the most obvious examples of inappropriate touching.
Can identify some examples of inappropriate touching with prompting.
Can independently identify many examples of inappropriate touching.
Can readily and accurately identify nearly all examples of inappropriate touching.
Can quickly and accurately identify all examples of inappropriate touching, including subtle or nuanced situations, and explains the reasoning clearly.
Does not suggest any appropriate responses to inappropriate touching.
Suggests only one or two ineffective or inappropriate responses.
Suggests a few potentially helpful responses, but may lack confidence or clarity.
Suggests several appropriate responses to inappropriate touching.
Suggests a variety of effective and appropriate responses to inappropriate touching, tailored to different situations.
Formulates and articulates a comprehensive strategy for responding to inappropriate touching, including assertive communication, seeking help, and reporting incidents.
